Pre-Game Insights: Cyprus has suffered an 8th consecutive defeat against Spain with a 3-1 loss in their Euro 2024 qualifying run.
Lithuania secured their position above Bulgaria in their group during the Euro 2024 qualifying campaign.
Lithuania posed a threat to stronger opponents, notably holding Hungary to a draw and scoring a late equalizer against Montenegro.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This friendly match concludes both teams' Euro 2024 qualifying campaigns, although neither side posed a threat to the top two spots in their respective groups.
Neither Cyprus nor Lithuania are eligible for a playoff spot due to their disappointing Nations League performances.
Others: Cyprus manager Ketsbaia might experiment with the lineup but could call upon key players like Grigoris Kastanos. However, Demetris Christofi is omitted due to limited club game time.
Lithuania will miss Eligijus Jankauskas and Paulius Golubickas due to injuries, while Artemijus Tutyskinas remains a long-term absentee.

Possible Lineups: Cyprus:(5-3-2) Mall; Andreou, Pileas, Gogic, Laifis, Anderson Correia; Kyriakou, Kyprianou, Charalampous; Kastanos, Pittas Lithuania:(4-3-3) Gertmonas; Lasickas, Girdvainis, Lekiatas, Sirvys; Utkus, Vorobjovas, Gineitis; Slivka, Paulaskas, Cernych
